data.title: The 50 Best Editorial Playlists For Dance Music On Spotify: Every List Fans Of Electronic Music Need To Know About
data.meta_description: Explore our Top 50 Editorial Playlists For Dance Music on Spotify, each a portal into EDM’s diverse world. Discover new genres, artists, and sounds!
data.text:
As electronic music expands and diversifies, Spotify stands at the forefront of curating the ultimate dance music experience. With its vast array of expertly curated playlists, the streaming giant provides a melodic journey through an expansive EDM-fueled landscape.

In this listicle article, we will dive deep into each playlist, embedding them for your listening pleasure while shedding light on their unique soundscape. Along the way, you will be introduced to notable artists who have left an indelible mark on each soundscape, ensuring you are equipped with the knowledge to plunge headfirst into the captivating world of dance music. So, let’s embark on this mission and discover the boundless creativity and innovation that defines EDM today.

Before diving in, make sure to follow our Fresh Finds playlist as well. It’s not an official editorial playlist, but it might as well be! It’s curated and updated weekly by our professional music editors, who constantly keep on the beat of the underground dance music scene and culture. ‎️‍ ‎️‍ ‎️‍

mint

mint offers a vibrant and pulsating selection of electronic music that keeps listeners grooving to infectious beats. This genre-spanning playlist primarily focuses on various forms of mainstream EDM, including subgenres like house, techno, and dance-pop. Notable artists such as Calvin Harris, Tiësto, Swedish House Mafia, and Alan Walker often appear, showcasing their latest hits and collaborations.

Racking up more than six million likes, the playlist exudes an energetic and uplifting vibe, perfect for both party nights and solo dance sessions. With its blend of euphoric melodies, driving rhythms, and catchy hooks, mint captures the essence of the ever-evolving electronic music scene, appealing to long-time enthusiasts and newcomers alike.

Dance Rising

The Dance Rising playlist on Spotify is a curated collection encompassing new-era sounds from top-tier artists, predominantly within the house music realm. Notable artists like Cloonee, SIDEPIECE, Wax Motif, Joel Corry, and Hayden James take the spotlight, showcasing their latest tracks and innovative creation, Through dynamic and contemporary selection, Dance Rising offers an electrifying atmosphere, making it an ideal choice for those seeking the cutting-edge sounds of the modern electronic music landscape.

Trap Mojito

This playlist offers a refreshing blend of electronic trap music, creating a sonic concoction that’s both invigorating and addictive. Featuring notable artists like RL Grime, TroyBoi, Flosstradamus, and ISOxo, the playlist delves into the intricacies of trap beats, fusing electronic elements with hip-hop-inspired rhythms. The tracks featured on Trap Mojito are a testament to the genre’s ability to create an adrenaline-fueled ambiance, where heavy basslines and intricate sound design intertwine seamlessly.

Chill Tracks

Boasting over 3.5 million likes, Chill Tracks embodies exactly what a listener would expect. It is chalk-full of deep house, delicately layered with soft effects and angelic lyrics. The artists that best reflect and most consistently appear on this playlist are Yotto, Lane 8, Tinlicker, Sultan + Shepard, and Nora En Pure. This is a solid compilation to hit shuffle on while going for a hike or long car ride.

Operator

“Operator, we have a problem.” This frequently utilized lyric in house anthems is probably how this playlist got its name. Hosting a platform for leading tech house technicians, notable artists from this editorial joint are Mau P, Biscits, J. Worra, James Hype, and Walker & Royce. John Summit and Dom Dolla also make frequent appearances. Do not hit shuffle on this playlist because the songs are perfectly mixed into one another.

Housewerk

Similar to Operator, Housewerk immerses listeners in the vibrant world of house music. However, it tends to lean to the more mainstream side of the subgenre. Featuring notable artists like Peggy Gou, Sonny Fodera, John Summit, FISHER, and Dom Dolla, the playlist offers a melodic journey that melds groovy basslines and soulful vocal hooks, catering to both dance floor junkies.

Altar

Altar on Spotify is a playlist that delves into the realm of alternative electronic music, crafting a serene and laid-back atmosphere that invites listeners to unwind. Curated with a focus on more chill vibes, Altar features tracks from notable artists like DJ Seinfeld, Disclosure, Maribou State, and Barry Can’t Swim, along with the new Jungle album. The playlist is a sonic sanctuary where alternative electronic melodies converge, offering a tranquil escape from the ordinary.

Altar’s mix of introspective soundscapes and innovative beats encapsulates a distinct genre that seamlessly merges electronic elements with a soothing ambiance, allowing listeners to find solace and inspiration in its ethereal compositions. Whether you’re seeking a backdrop for introspection or a gentle sonic journey, Altar provides a curated space where alternative electronic music flourishes in all its contemplative splendor.

Tantra

Taking its name from the ancient spiritual practice, this playlist embodies a harmonious fusion of melodic house and melodic techno. Tantra creates a sonic adventure that invites listeners to explore their inner landscapes. Featuring notable artists like Adriatique, Anyma, Miss Monique, Monkey Safari, and Stephan Jolk, the playlist captures the essence of these genres’ emotive qualities. It is a musical voyage where rhythmic complexities intertwine with lush melodies, mirroring the intricate balance of ancient philosophy.

Techno Bunker

We are still patiently waiting for techno to rise to the top of North America’s EDM circuit. It is arguably the biggest electronic-based genre in Europe, setting the tone for the underground rave scene. This playlist is great for lifelong techno fans and listeners who are just getting into it. Techno Bunker embraces the dark elements and haunting basslines from artists such as Belocca, Amelie Lens, Charlotte De Witte, UMEK, and Layton Giordani.

Nasty Bits

Nasty Bits on Spotify enters the realms of bass house and brostep, crafting a playlist that pulsates with raw energy and electrifying beats. The name itself suggests the edgy and intense nature of the music featured. With tracks carefully chosen to ignite a fiery sonic experience, Nasty Bits showcases notable artists such as AC Slater, Habstrakt, BIJOU, Malaa, Dr. Fresch, and Knock2. This playlist is a riveting playground where the lines between bass-heavy house and aggressive dubstep blur, amalgamating gritty basslines and explosive drops.

Bass Arcade

Bass Arcade is ideal for those who seek unconventional auditory experiences, as it showcases the evolution of bass-driven genres while maintaining an air of unpredictability. Whether you are in pursuit of rousing basslines or an unorthodox musical journey, Bass Arcade delivers a mind-bending selection that’s sure to challenge and captivate your senses. Encapsulating the hottest DJ-producer hybrids in dubstep and experimental bass, regulars are CloZee, Zeds Dead, Rezz, and NGHTMRE.

Happy Beats

Let the sun shine down on you and show off that big smile! This is the overall mood of Happy Beats. Optimal for a day at the beach with your closest friends, Happy Beats is overflowing with feel-good dance music. Ranging from uplifting house to piano-driven disco, the top-tier editorial playlist includes the likes of LP Giobbi, KC Lights, Mark Knight, D.O.D. Tensnake, and Noizu to name a few. As a result, prominent labels such as FEMME HOUSE, Toolroom, and Defected are often featured.

Dubstep Don

Where are all our wooks at? Dubstep Don is the prime location for bassheads to congregate, circling the latest bangers in heavy dubstep. Curating a playlist that’s a haven for those who crave intense and powerful bassline, the title Dubstep Don aptly captures the commanding nature of its music. Showcasing tracks that are carefully chosen to deliver an electrifying punch, the playlist features notable artists such as 12th Planet, Ray Volpe, Apashe, Riot Ten, and Sullivan King. Dubstep reigns supreme across Dubstep Don.

Brain Food

On the complete opposite side of the EDM spectrum, lies Brain Food. This weekly updated compilation offers a nice change of pace to its audience. It is designed to exhibit hypnotic electronic soundscapes for people trying to study or relax. With that target group in mind, it comes as no surprise that this playlist has accumulated nearly 3.7 million likes. Get lost in seven hours of enchanting tracks, welded by a wide variety of talented artists like Mild Minds, Catching Flies, Leaving Laurel, and ford.

Phonk

In the universe of EDM, phonk refers to a subgenre that merges electronic music elements with the distinctive sounds of phonk hip-hop. It incorporates lo-fi textures, chopped samples, and slow tempos, often evoking a hazy and nostalgic ambiance. By fusing electronic production techniques with the raw and gritty essence of phonk, this subgenre offers a unique and experimental sonic experience within the musical landscape. Simply titled the name of the subgenre, Phonk has a whopping 6 million-plus likes. Frequently featured artists are Slowboy, NXVAMANE, S3BZS, INTERWORLD, and Dxrk ダーク.

metropolis

metropolis on Spotify invites listeners to explore a sonic realm at the crossroads of indie dance, chill EDM, and disco, creating a vibrant, danceable, and melodically rich playlist. Drawing inspiration from the urban energy of a metropolis, this playlist showcases notable artists such as NEIL FRANCES, Jungle, ODESZA, Goth Babe, and Mindchatter. It’s a musical cityscape where groovy beats and mesmerizing vocals intersect, making it the perfect soundtrack for those seeking a dynamic blend of electronic genres that transport them to the heart of the concrete jungle.

Dance Hits

Seeing David Guetta on the cover of this playlist instantly tells you what it is all about. Bringing the latest anthems in mainstream dance and house music, Dance Hits frequently shows off Dombresky, Imanbek, Matroda, ACRAZE, Duke Dumont, and many other DJ-producer hybrids. When a new popular EDM-based song drops, you can definitely bet on it securing a spot in this compilation. For example, near the top is FISHER’s recent heater “Atmosphere” and Swedish House Mafia’s “Ray Of Solar”.

Tomorrowland Essentials

Tomorrowland is one of the world’s most renowned and colossal music festivals, celebrated for its extravagant stage designs, top-tier lineups, and immersive experiences. Held annually in Boom, Belgium, it transforms the small town into a global EDM mecca, attracting music enthusiasts from across the globe. Tomorrowland is more than just a festival; it’s a multi-day, fantasy-filled journey that brings together EDM’s biggest names and a diverse, passionate crowd to create unforgettable memories in a magical, fairytale-like atmosphere. Sometimes, a new Tomorrowland performing artist does a takeover for this playlist, whether they are playing at the main Tomorrowland or one of its expansions.

Trance Mission

Trance music is a genre characterized by its hypnotic and repetitive melodies, often accompanied by a steady beat and a strong focus on building emotional intensity. It aims to create a trance-like state in the listener through its euphoric and uplifting soundscapes, making it a popular choice for dance music enthusiasts. Progressive music, on the other hand, is known for its evolving and evolving sound structures. It typically starts with a simple melody or rhythm and gradually adds layers and complexity as the track progresses.

Pop Remix

Pop Remix is a must-have playlist for fans of both pop and dance music. Encompassing songs like Tiësto’s remix of “Barbie Girl” by Aqua, ACRAZE’s take on “Unholy” by Sam Smith, and Wuki’s reimagining of “Edge of Seventeen,” this playlist offers a fresh and exciting spin on beloved pop classics. It’s a captivating collection that showcases the creativity and innovation that remix culture brings to the world of music.

Ultra Gaming

This high-energy playlist bridges multiple electronic music genres, making it a go-to compilation for gamers and music enthusiasts alike. With a fusion of dance, bass, EDM, trap, and phonk, this playlist offers diverse tracks that keep the energy levels soaring. Featuring notable artists such as its murph, Kx5, Eli Brown, Vintage Culture, ATRIP, and ZHU, ‘Ultra Gaming’ provides the perfect backdrop for epic gaming sessions or lively gatherings.

Hype

Hype is a high-octane playlist designed to fuel intense gym sessions, sporting a rousing melting pot of aggressive trap and bass tracks. With noteworthy artists such as Excision, RL Grime, Zeds Dead, Subtronics, and PEEKABOO, this playlist delivers a relentless sonic onslaught that amps up the adrenaline. Hype is your essential soundtrack for pushing through challenging workouts, as it combines bone-rattling bass drops and fierce beats to keep you pumped and motivated throughout your fitness journey. Peep this playlist to download DIESEL’s (aka Shaq) new album.

Deep House Relax

In the vast realm of Spotify, Deep House Relax emerges as a serene playlist that embraces the essence of deep and melodic house music. Crafted by notable artists like Simon Doty, Eli & Fur, Nora En Pure, Marsh, and Stephan Jolk, to name a few, this collection weaves soulful melodies and mellow vibes into a musical sanctuary. It is the perfect antidote for those in search of a tranquil backdrop for relaxation, meditation, or unwinding after a demanding day.

Remix Hits

Drawing on some of the EDM community’s favorite songs in the past, Remix Hits takes these classics and transforms them into something brand-new and captivating. This is done with the help of artists like Kungs, Dubdogz, David Guetta and more. Prominent remixes that are currently embedded in this playlist is a remix of Coldplay’s “Paradise” by Tiësto, and one of Dya Lipa’s “Don’t Start Now” by Purple Disco Machine.

Retrowave // Outrun

Retrowave, also known as synthwave or outrun, is a subgenre of electronic music that takes inspiration from the sounds, styles, and aesthetics of 1980s and early 1990s pop culture, particularly from movies, video games, and TV shows. It conspicuously boasts synthesizers, drum machines, and nostalgic retro-futuristic elements to create a distinct and evocative sound. Retrowave often evokes a sense of yearning for old times, transporting listeners back to an era of neon lights, VHS tapes, and the analog future that was envisioned in the past. This is conveyed through producers like Owl Vision, Adieu Aru, JODA, Gunship, and The Toxic Avenger.

Power Hour

It is difficult to analyze if Power Hour gets its listeners from fitness, dance music, or a healthy mix of both topics. Say hello to your new ultimate playlist for cardio sessions and exhilarating bike rides. Having a compound of mainstream house, deep house, and tech house tracks, this playlist delivers an uptempo vibe designed to keep your feet moving. Among the wide array of featured artists lies DubVision, KREAM, ACRAZE, Gorgon City, and Kx5.

creamy

In the ever-evolving world of electronic music, there emerged a genre known as future bass. Picture this: a musical landscape that effortlessly intertwines elements from various electronic subgenres, such as trap, dubstep, and pop. What sets future bass apart is its ability to tell a story through sound. Also, future bass is all about balance; it is a genre that takes you on a roller coaster of emotions, starting with dreamy, atmospheric build-ups that pull you into their world. Just when you are lost in the reverie, it surprises you with explosive drops, delivering a surge of energy that’s impossible to resist. Scroll through creamy to find the best future bass and chill EDM creators, from Louis The Child and DROELOE to pluko and Chet Porter.

Beast Mode Dance

Flipping the script of Spotify’s Hype editorial playlist, Beast Mode Dance has an identical intended effect. It is designed to be played during a workout, making for a great alternative to C4 pre-workout or a Monster energy drink. Overflowing with the latest house and techno heaters, this playlist is sure to get your blood boiling and muscles twitching. At the beacon of Beast Mode Dance is Chris Lorenzo, Anyma, Will Clarke, Westend, and Chris Lake.

Shuffle Syndrome

Welcome to Shuffle Syndrome, the musical prescription for those afflicted with a chronic case of dance fever. In this playlist, the house music scene takes center stage, presenting a vibrant medley of sounds that will have you shuffling your feet and spinning to the rhythm. Featuring notable artists like Loud Luxury, Wade, The Chainsmokers, Alok, and Curbi, Shuffle Syndrome’ is your auditory remedy, delivering a healthy dose of house music in all its contagious forms. Whether you’re looking to cure your musical monotony or simply can’t resist the urge to dance, this playlist is your prescription for a groovy time.

Dance Classics

Think back to those unforgettable nights on the dance floor when euphoria filled the air, and the beats of trance, progressive house, and techno ruled the scene. That is what Dance Classics will forge in your mind, supporting artists like Cosmic Gate, Steve Angello, and Morgan Page. These artists, alongside many others, provided the anthems that had everyone moving, from the infectious melodies of Tiësto to the soulful vibes of Kaskade. Hope in a time machine to the forefront of dance’s revolution via this playlist.

Heart Beats

Clearly one of the cooler concepts across Spotify’s editorial playlists, Heart Beats zeros in on the emotional connections that EDM ritualistically embraces. This compilation spans a broad spectrum of electronic subgenres but it all comes together in a beautiful symphony. While ILLENIUM drops heavy melodic bass, Elderbrook and Lastings execute chilling vocals and soft, delicate basslines. Appearances from Surf Mesa, Kygo, and ZHU can be witnessed too.

Bangers

Bangers on Spotify is a playlist that catapults you into the world of music’s most thrilling phenomenon – the “banger.” Handpicked for their undeniable energy, these tracks belong to the realm of house and bass, and they all share a common trait: sick basslines that can shake the very foundations of any party.

But what exactly is a banger in music? It is more than just a song; it is a sonic powerhouse contrived to make you move, feel the rhythm in your bones, and surrender to the overwhelming urge to dance. Notable artists like Skrillex, Kyle Watson, Dom Dolla, Mau P, and southstar know the secret recipe for crafting these musical dynamites.

Las Vegas Pool Party

Las Vegas Pool Party on Spotify is a spirited playlist that transports listeners to the heart of Sin City’s iconic pool party scene. Focused on Latin and mainstream dance anthems, this curated selection hosts leading artists such as HUGEL, Tiësto, Jonas Blue, Becky G, Gordo, and Marshmello. With its lively and feel-good tracks, Las Vegas Pool Party captures the essence of sun-soaked revelry and non-stop dancing, making it the ultimate soundtrack for poolside gatherings, beach parties, and general celebration. Dive into this playlist and immerse yourself in Las Vegas’s darty culture, no matter where you are.

Lo-Fi House

This is definitely one of the more obscure editorial playlists on the list, and may be an acquired taste for most listeners. Lo-fi house is a subgenre of electronic music characterized by its intentionally raw, gritty, and vintage sound. It often features elements like warm, analog synthesizers, vinyl crackle, and distorted samples, giving it a nostalgic and lo-fi aesthetic. It usually embodies a slower tempo and repetitive structure, becoming a solid fit for both relaxing and dancing. In this playlist, bump to off-the-grid artists such as Grey Killer, Kolter, Gene on Earth, and Robert Babicz.

Rocktronic

Where heavy dubstep and heavy metal collide, is the likes of Grabbitz, Sullivan King, Rezz, Infected Mushroom, Kai Wachi, and other gifted artists across Spotify’s Rocktronic playlist. Rocktronic is a genre that melds the power and instrumentation of rock with the electronic elements of synths, samples, and beats. It is a fusion that blurs the boundaries between the analog and digital realms, resulting in a dynamic sonic landscape that’s both edgy and futuristic. Rocktronic’s signature sound is marked by its ability to seamlessly blend electric guitar riffs and rock vocals with electronic textures, creating a genre that’s as exciting as it is innovative.

Big Room Dance

Also known as main-stage music, big room dance is a subgenre of EDM centered around a larger-than-life sound, soaring melodies, colossal build-ups, and massive drops. It often features pounding kick drums and thrilling synths that are designed to ignite festival crowds and create an ambiance of pure happiness. Big room dance tracks are tailor-made for the main stages of EDM festivals, where they captivate audiences with their anthemic and explosive sound. Popular artists that make appearances in this playlist are Oliver Heldens, W&W, Hardwell, Will Sparks, and Steve Aoki.

90s House Classics

Regularly referred to as the golden era of house music, the 90s was a transformative time for this genre, marked by infectious basslines and soulful vocals. Additionally, the rise of iconic subgenres like acid house and progressive house took place in the 90s. A myriad of legendary tracks can be found in this playlist from the 90s, sourced from its pioneers that ruled the dance floor. Armand Van Helden, Junior Jack, Hardrive, Kerri Chandler, and ATFC are just some of the names that pop up in 90s House Classics.

Deep House Blend

Although we have had a few deep house themed playlists grace this list already, Deep House Blend brings a one-of-a-kind display of sound to the table. It includes all types of deep house and any subgenre that is closely related to it. The main section of deep house is bolstered by progressive house, tropical house, melodic house, and ethnic house. A diverse grouping of artists are showcased, such as Set Mo, Oliver Schories, Mona Yim, Bedouin, Ben Böhmer, and Rampa.

SLAP!

Buried in the core of this playlist is the bassline. For those unfamiliar, a bassline is the low-frequency, rhythmically driven melody in a piece of music, often played by instruments like bass guitars, synthesizers, or electronic keyboards. It provides the essential foundation and groove to a track, creating a harmonic structure that underpins the entire composition. In this case, the bassline consists of kick drums and snares for the majority of the tunes in SLAP!. Artists to shed light on are DJ Kuba, BEAUZ, MistaJam, Loud Luxury, and Bassjackers.

EDM Samplings

An EDM sampling is not necessarily a remix when it involves taking a portion of an existing song and incorporating it into a new composition without fundamentally altering the original track’s structure, melody, or arrangement. In such instances, it is more accurately described as a “sampled track” or a “sampled song” rather than a remix.

A remix typically involves reimagining and restructuring the original song, often with the addition of new elements and creative reinterpretation, resulting in a distinct and recognizable transformation of the source material. Sampling, on the other hand, can sometimes be a straightforward incorporation of a portion of the original song without substantial alteration, serving as a homage or an element within a new piece of music. The sample maestros in this playlist are BLOND:ISH, Autograf, Goodboys, Alok, Kaleena Zanders, Dubdogz, and more.

French Touch

Believe it or not, French Touch is a subgenre of electronic music that emerged in France during the 1990s and early 2000s. It is characterized by its emphasis on disco and funk-inspired house music, normally attributing to catchy melodies, groovy basslines, and empowering vocal samples. Daft Punk, Justice, Modjo, Bob Sinclar, and Stardust played a pivotal role in shaping and popularizing this genre, both in their home country and on the global stage. French Touch brought a touch of elegance and sophistication to the EDM circuit, and its influence continues to resonate in dance music today.

Psytrance Supernova

Psytrance, short for psychedelic trance, is a subgenre of electronic dance music known for its magnetizing, mind-bending, and otherworldly soundscapes. It is characterized by a fast tempo, typically ranging from 140 to 150 beats per minute, intricate rhythmic patterns, and a strong emphasis on spellbinding melodies and atmospheric textures. Psytrance often creates a transformative and immersive experience for listeners, drawing inspiration from various psychedelic and trance-inducing elements to create a unique and euphoric transonic adventure. Notable artists in this playlist are Vini Vici, Neelix, Astrix, Liquid Soul, Ranji, and Durs.

Electronic Rising

For anyone who is looking for hidden gems and the freshest new-era sounds, Electronic Rising is the place to be. It serves as a sonic portal to the cutting edge of electronic music, traversing the dance music orbit from electronica to techno. This curated collection highlights the most innovative tracks from emerging and established artists alike. Some artists that have recently earned placement in Electronic Rising are Eelke Kleijn, SKIY, Mindchatter, Booka Shade, Einmusik, Enamour, and Boris Brejcha.

DOWN LOW

There is simply no other playlist like DOWN LOW on Spotify. It is music that makes you feel like a boss and is synced in many TikToks that surround nice suits, fast cars, and luxury lifestyles. An intricate coalition of trap, Brazilian bass, and bass house, a large portion of the producers in DOWN LOW might be unfamiliar to you. This movement is growing heavily in Europe and Asia, but should soon be touching down in the states. Get a sneak preview of boundary-pushing artists like JVLA, HVZVRD, Obzkure, WYR GEMI, and Ozlig, to close out our list.
